article_title: Fokker Services to Pay $21M over Sanctions Violations
article_text: As the financial market volatility that sparked economic concerns earlier in 2016 has abated, the global economy has improved and the outlook for U.S. companies and the U.S. economy has steadied despite weak first-quarter growth. Still, there are reasons many CFOs may retain the trepidation expressed in Deloitte’s first-quarter CFO Signals™ survey. Dr. Ira Kalish, chief global economist, Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, discusses whether the factors that caused CFOs’ downward company expectations could reoccur and looks at other potential risks that could impact the global economy.

twitter.description: Fokker Services B.V. agreed to pay $21 million to settle allegations it violated U.S. sanctions on Iran, Sudan and Myanmar.
twitter.title: Fokker Services to Pay $21M over Sanctions Violations
